item.text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; its length was 45 inches, its width 27 inches, and its height 27 inches.

He <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> it with <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="01004" class="">inside</st> and <st data-num="02351" class="">out</st>, and he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="02213" class="">border</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> for it.

He <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> for it that he put<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> its <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">feet</st>, with<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">side</st> and <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="08145" class="">other</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">side</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> of <st data-num="07848" class="">acacia</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st>, <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> them with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>,
and put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark in order to carry the ark.
He made an atonement lid of pure gold; its length was 45 inches, and its width was 27 inches.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> of <st data-num="02091">gold</st>; he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> them of <st data-num="04749" class="">hammered metal</st> on the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="07098" class="">ends</st> of the <st data-num="03727" class="">atonement lid</st>,

<st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub</st> on <st data-num="02088" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07098" class="">end</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="03742" class="">cherub</st> on the <st data-num="02088" class="">other</st> <st data-num="07098" class="">end</st>.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="03727" class="">atonement lid</st> on its <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="07118" class="">ends</st>.
The cherubim were spreading their wings upward, overshadowing the atonement lid with their wings. The cherubim faced each other, looking toward the atonement lid.
Bezalel made the table of acacia wood; its length was 36 inches, its width 18 inches, and its height 27 inches.

He <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> it with <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, and he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="02213" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> for it.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="04526" class="">frame</st> for it <st data-num="02948" class="">about three inches wide</st>, and he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="02213" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> for its <st data-num="04526" class="">frame</st>.

He <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> for it and <st data-num="05414" class="">attached</st> the <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="06285" class="">corners</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> its <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="07272" class="">legs</st> were.

The <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="05980" class="">close to</st> the <st data-num="04526" class="">frame</st> to provide <st data-num="01004" class="">places</st> for the <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> to <st data-num="05375" class="">carry</st> the <st data-num="07979" class="">table</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> of <st data-num="07848" class="">acacia</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> and <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> them with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, to <st data-num="05375" class="">carry</st> the <st data-num="07979" class="">table</st>.
He made the vessels which were on the table out of pure gold, its plates, its ladles, its pitchers, and its bowls, to be used in pouring out offerings.
Bezalel made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of hammered metal; its base and its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were from the same piece.

<st data-num="08337" class="">Six</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> were <st data-num="03318" class="">extending</st> from its <st data-num="06654" class="">sides</st>, <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> of the <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstand</st> from <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">side</st> of it, and <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> of the <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstand</st> from the <st data-num="08145" class="">other</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">side</st> of it.

<st data-num="07969" class="">Three</st> <st data-num="01375" class="">cups</st> <st data-num="08246" class="">shaped like almond flowers</st> with <st data-num="03730" class="">buds</st> and <st data-num="06525" class="">blossoms</st> were on the <st data-num="0259" class="">first</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branch</st>, and <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01375" class="">cups</st> <st data-num="08246" class="">shaped like almond flowers</st> with <st data-num="03730" class="">buds</st> and <st data-num="06525" class="">blossoms</st> were on the <st data-num="0259" class="">next</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07070" class="">branch</st>, and the <st data-num="03651" class="">same</st><n id="2" /> for the <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> that were <st data-num="03318" class="">extending</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstand</st>.

On the <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstand</st> there were <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="01375" class="">cups</st> <st data-num="08246" class="">shaped like almond flowers</st> with <st data-num="03730" class="">buds</st> and <st data-num="06525" class="">blossoms</st>,

with a <st data-num="03730" class="">bud</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> the first <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it, and a <st data-num="03730" class="">bud</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> the next <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it, and a <st data-num="03730" class="">bud</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> the third <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it; according to the <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> that <st data-num="03318" class="">extended</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it.<n id="1" />

Their <st data-num="03730" class="">buds</st> and their <st data-num="07070" class="">branches</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> one piece;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of it was <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="04749" class="">hammered piece</st> of <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> its <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="05216" class="">lamps</st>, its <st data-num="04457" class="">trimmers</st>, and its <st data-num="04289" class="">trays</st> of <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>.
He made the lampstand and all its accessories with seventy-five pounds of pure gold.
Bezalel made the incense altar of acacia wood. Its length was 18 inches and its width 18 inches—a square—and its height was 36 inches. Its horns were of one piece with it.

He <st data-num="06823" class="">overlaid</st> it with <st data-num="02889" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>—its <st data-num="01406" class="">top</st>,<n id="1" /> its <st data-num="05439" class="">four</st> <st data-num="07023" class="">walls</st>,<n id="2" /> and its <st data-num="07161" class="">horns</st>—and he <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounding</st> <st data-num="02213" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> for it.<n id="3" />

He also <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="02885" class="">rings</st> for it <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> its <st data-num="02213" class="">border</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> its <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06763" class="">sides</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">opposite</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">sides</st>,<n id="2" /> as <st data-num="01004" class="">places</st><n id="3" /> for <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> to <st data-num="05375" class="">carry</st> it with.
He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
He made the sacred anointing oil and the pure fragrant incense, the work of a perfumer.
